metadata.title: Don't Stop Now Keep The Good Times Rollin' - Complete Singles As & Bs 1952-1962 - Shirley & Lee's Golden Decade ORIGINAL RECORDINGS REMASTERED SET
description: Fats Domino and Lloyd Price had put New Orleans as an R&B city on the map in the late 40s and early 50s but it was perhaps the teenage 'sweethearts' Shirley & Lee who helped propel New Orleans R&B into the maelstrom of American popular music. There is no question that Shirley & Lee made a major contribution to the history of rock & roll and rhythm & blues and the 62 tracks presented here tracks all of their singles up until 1962 in chronological order. Includes their first hit single "I'm Gone" and its B side "Sweethearts" which although not a hit was equally as popular along with "Feel So Good", "Let The Good Times Roll", "I Feel Good" plus many more. Detailed liner notes covering the duos career.
